parameters.definition: Ratio of mechanical keyboards to standard keyboards
Units of plastic required for one mechanical keyboard
Units of solder required for one mechanical keyboard
Units of plastic required for one standard keyboard
Units of solder required for one standard keyboard
Minimum number of standard keyboards to be produced

description: A keyboard manufacturer makes mechanical and standard keyboards. The manufacturer aims to have \param{RatioMechanicalStandard} times as many mechanical than standard keyboards. A mechanical keyboard costs \param{PlasticPerMechanical} units of plastic and \param{SolderPerMechanical} units of solder whereas a standard keyboard costs \param{PlasticPerStandard} units of plastic and \param{SolderPerStandard} unit of solder. There must be at least \param{MinStandard} standard keyboards. If the company has available \param{TotalPlastic} units of plastic and \param{TotalSolder} units of solder, how many of each type should be manufactured to maximize the total number of keyboards?
